alert.note: Alert for Delta; Hopkins; Lamar (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 11 at 8:05AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Delta, Hopkins, and Lamar Counties * WHEN...Until 1030 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall which will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen, with additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches possible through 10 AM. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sulphur Springs, Cooper, Cumby, Como, Lake Sulphur Springs, Cooper Lake State Park, Cooper Lake, Sulphur Bluff, Brashear, Saltillo, Big Creek Lake, Pickton, Klondike, Lake Fork Reservoir, Pattonville, Deport, Pine Forest, Tira, Birthright and New Birthright.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
